title: Public transport for Guns N’ Roses in concert: Saturday 3 December 2022
articleContent:
Public transport for Guns N’ Roses in concert: Saturday 3 December 2022

Stadium rock is back at the “G” with Guns N’ Roses in concert. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, and to how a great music experience. Extra services will help you get to and from the MCG on Saturday 3 December 2022.

Concert starts at 7pm

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Metropolitan train

Forward services to Jolimont Station

  • Mernda – leaving at 5:36pm (Arriving at Jolimont 6:26pm on Platform 1)
  • Greensborough - leaving at 5:40pm (Arriving at Jolimont 6:16pm on Platform 1)

Forward services to Richmond Station

  • Sandringham – leaving at 5:45pm (Arriving at Richmond 6:13pm on Platform 1)
  • Sunbury - leaving at 5:03pm (Arriving at Richmond 5:55pm on Platform 2)

Return service from Jolimont Station

  • Mernda – leaving at 11:03pm, 11:22pm and 11:33pm from Platform 2
  • Eltham – leaving at 11:17pm and 11:38pm from Platform 2
  • Greensborough - leaving at 11:07pm from Platform 2
  • Flinders Street – leaving at 11:05pm, 11:11pm, 11:19pm and 11:27pm from Platform 1

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Westall - leaving at 11:08pm and 11:54pm from Platform 6
  • Dandenong – leaving at 11:23pm from Platform 6
  • Cranbourne – leaving at 11:35pm and 12:04am from Platform 6
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:59pm, 11:15pm and 11:35pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 11:14pm and 11:35pm from Platform 2
  • Sunbury – leaving at 11:11pm from Platform 1

Return service from Flinders Street Station

  • Sunbury – leaving at 11:17pm from Platform 10

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the MCG

Route 70

  • Passengers can catch tram services alighting at Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Route 75

  • Passengers can catch tram services alighting at Stop 13 Wellington Parade/Simpson Street.

Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station

V/Line Additional services

Return Additional service from Southern Cross Station

  • Geelong (Geelong) – leaving at 12:02am
  • Bacchus Marsh (Ballarat) – leaving at 12:16am

Return Additional capacity from Southern Cross Station

  • 11:55pm – Bendigo (Bendigo) additional seats
  • 12:16am – Wendouree (Ballarat) additional seats
articleDescription: Public transport for Guns N’ Roses in concert: Saturday 3 December 2022
